CheckTitle: HSTS includes subdomains directive for comprehensive protection
Description: **Cloudflare zones** are assessed for **HSTS includeSubDomains** directive by checking if it is configured to enforce HTTPS across all subdomains, preventing **SSL stripping attacks** on any subdomain.
Risk:
Without **includeSubDomains**, subdomains remain vulnerable even when the main domain has HSTS enabled.
- **Confidentiality**: attackers can intercept traffic on unprotected subdomains
- **Integrity**: SSL stripping attacks can downgrade subdomain connections to HTTP
- **Trust**: inconsistent security policy across the domain hierarchy

Code.Other:
1. Log in to the Cloudflare dashboard and select your account and domain
2. Go to SSL/TLS > Edge Certificates
3. Scroll to HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS)
4. Click Configure or Edit
5. Enable Include subdomains
6. Acknowledge the warning and click Save

Recommendation.Text:
Enable **includeSubDomains** after verifying all subdomains support HTTPS.
- Ensures consistent security policy across the entire domain hierarchy
- Prevents SSL stripping attacks on any subdomain
- Required for HSTS preload list submission
- Test all subdomains thoroughly before enabling to avoid accessibility issues

Notes: Ensure all subdomains are accessible via HTTPS before enabling includeSubDomains to avoid accessibility issues. This is a prerequisite for HSTS preloading.
